title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 32): Permaculture Guilds as Power With Ecological Coordination
summary: A guide to forming permaculture guilds that center interdependence and shared stewardship while avoiding expert gatekeeping and hierarchical patterns.

Food.summary: Create collaborative food growing systems based on ecological principles and community stewardship.

level0: Start small food gardens using permaculture principles
Share seeds, tools, and knowledge with neighbors
Practice companion planting and natural pest management
level1: Form a local permaculture learning circle with diverse participants
Create shared garden spaces using consensus decision-making
Develop water harvesting and soil building projects together
level2: Establish food forests and perennial polycultures as community spaces
Host skill-shares on permaculture design and ecological principles
Connect with other permaculture guilds for knowledge exchange
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous permaculture guilds
Create bioregional networks of ecological stewardship
Advocate for policy changes supporting community land access

Community.summary: Build relationships and shared responsibility through collaborative land stewardship and ecological learning.

level0: Gather diverse neighbors interested in land care and food growing
Host potlucks and informal meetings to discuss shared ecological values
Practice working together on small garden projects
level1: Establish group agreements for shared decision-making and land stewardship
Create accessible and inclusive participation in all garden activities
Develop systems for sharing labor, tools, and knowledge equitably
level2: Build lasting relationships through seasonal rhythms and shared harvests
Host community events that celebrate ecological and social connections
Practice conflict resolution and mutual accountability in land work
level3: Mentor new permaculture guilds and share organizing knowledge
Build networks of ecological communities for mutual support
Create lasting infrastructure for community-controlled land stewardship

Knowledge.summary: Share ecological knowledge horizontally while learning from traditional and Indigenous land practices.

level0: Learn permaculture ethics and principles through hands-on practice
Study local Indigenous land management practices and traditional knowledge
level1: Practice observational skills and ecological design thinking
Document and share permaculture experiments and learning
Learn from elders and traditional knowledge holders in your area
level2: Host workshops on permaculture design and ecological restoration
Create open-source resources about local ecological practices
Share knowledge with other guilds while respecting cultural protocols
level3: Research and document impacts of community-controlled ecological design
Support policy changes that protect traditional ecological knowledge
